v.v: As dead flies cause perfume to stink,
The heart of a wise person tends to the right,
When a fool walks down a road,
If the emotions of a ruler rise up against you, do not leave your work.
There is an evil that I have seen under the sun,
Fools are given leadership positions,
I have seen slaves riding horses,
Anyone who digs a pit
Whoever cuts out stones
If an iron blade is dull, and a man does not sharpen it, then he must use more strength, but wisdom provides an advantage for success.
If a snake bites before it is charmed,
The words of a wise man’s mouth are gracious,
As words begin to flow from a fool’s mouth, foolishness comes out,
A fool multiplies words,
The toil of fools wearies them,
Woe to you, land, if your king is a young boy,
But blessed are you, land, if your king is the son of nobles,
Because of laziness the roof sinks in,
People prepare food for laughter,
Do not curse the king, not even in your mind,

v: so a little folly can overpower wisdom and honor.
but the heart of a fool tends to the left.
his thinking is deficient,
proving to everyone he is a fool.
Calm can quiet down great outrage.
a kind of error that comes from a ruler:
while successful men are given low positions.
and successful men walking like slaves on the ground.
can fall into it, and whenever someone breaks down a wall,
a snake can bite him.
can be hurt by them,
and the man who chops wood
is endangered by it.
then there is no advantage for the charmer.
but the lips of a fool consume him.
and at the end his mouth flows with wicked madness.
but no one knows what is coming.
Who knows what is coming after him?
so that they do not even know the road to town.
and if your leaders begin feasting in the morning!
and if your leaders eat at the right time,
for strength, and not for drunkenness!
and because of idle hands the house leaks.
wine brings enjoyment to life,
and money fills the need for everything.
and do not curse rich people in your bedroom.
For a bird of the sky might carry your words;
whatever has wings can spread the matter.
